title: URGERS: Ultra-lightweight Contrastive Learning Encoder for ECG Processor supporting both Authentication and Arhythmia Classification
details: J Zhou, L Chang, H Fan, H Li, Y Chen, S Lin, J Zhou - Integrated Circuits and Systems, 2024
abstract: Deep learning typically requires large amounts of labeled data and often struggles with generalization, posing challenges for intelligent systems. In the real world, most electrocardiogram (ECG) signals are unlabeled, which limits the use of smart devices …

title: Multisource representation learning for pediatric knowledge extraction from electronic health records
details: M Li, X Li, K Pan, A Geva, D Yang, SM Sweet… - npj Digital Medicine, 2024
abstract: Abstract Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems are particularly valuable in pediatrics due to high barriers in clinical studies, but pediatric EHR data often suffer from low content density. Existing EHR code embeddings tailored for the general …

title: Towards Better Interpretability of Sepsis Prediction by Deep Neural Networks with Variable-wise Attribution Maps
details: PE Thiboud, V Wargnier-Dauchelle, M Lefort… - 2024
abstract: Because of the multi-symptomatic nature of sepsis, its prediction is challenging as it requires considering subtle changes in multiple monitored variables across time. Recent works based on deep neural networks improved the prediction performance …
